meanings.definition: To surpass in offering a bribe.
meanings.sent1: She outbribes her competitors to win the contract.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman always outbribes others to get what he wants.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox outbribes the clever rabbit with a shiny apple.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, money often outbribes honesty.
meanings.sent5: His determination to outbribe his opponents is unmatched.

meanings.definition: To bribe more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He outbribes his rivals by offering larger sums of money.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt official outbribes his colleagues to maintain power.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outbribes the dog with a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Her charm and wit outbribes any monetary offer.
meanings.sent5: The allure of power often outbribes moral values.
